author: @curtain300
text: (pygameparachute)  segmentation fault whats this error??  import pygame  pygame.init() black=(0,0,0) Display=pygame.display.set_mode((800,600))  Display.fill(black) pixAr=pygame.PixelArray(Display)  Display.fill(black) pixAr=pygame.PixelArray(Display) pixAr[10][20]= "green"  while True():     for event in pygame.event.get():         if event.type==pygame.QUIT:             pygame.quit()             quit()          pygame.display.update()

author: @damianwojakowski3006
text: In one of your videos you mentioned that it's weird that RGB settings for black color is 0, 0, 0.  A thought just came to my mind - look above yourself... way above. What is there? The Universe, the space. There's obviously nothing in the space and it's... not white. ; )  It seems that nothing...ness is black, and 0, 0, 0 for black now looks all right.
